title: Mattiline Render
text: Mattiline Render (born February 17, 1947) is an American <a href="sprint%20%28running%29">sprinter</a>. In 1971 she won a gold medal in the 4 × 100 m relay at the Pan American Games and set a world record in the 4×110 yard relay. The year after, she competed in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20100%20metres">100 m</a> and 4 × 100 m events at the <a href="1972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a> and placed fourth in the relay. During her career Render ran for <a href="Tennessee%20State%20University">Tennessee State University</a>, <a href="Temple%20University">Temple University</a> and <a href="Police%20Athletic%20League%20of%20New%20York%20City">New York Police Athletic League</a>.
